title: Privacy Policy
intro: At W2 Tech Solutions, your privacy is not an afterthoughtâ€”it is a core feature of our architecture. This policy explains how we handle your information across our website and our business applications.

sections.title: 1. The "Local-First" Data Principle
sections.content:
Most of our business tools, including the Agency Management System, are built with a "Local-First" architecture.

Business Data: Sensitive information like your inventory, creditor lists, and profit margins are stored locally on your device.

Zero Access: W2 Tech Solutions does not have access to your local database. We cannot see, sell, or share your business data because we never receive it.

sections.title: 2. Information We Collect
sections.content:
We only collect the bare minimum required to provide you with our services:

Communication Data: If you contact us for support or sign up for updates via email, we store your email address and name to respond to you.

Website Analytics: We use basic, privacy-friendly analytics on our website to see which tools are popular. This does not identify you personally.

sections.title: 3. Data Analytics Engine
sections.content:
Our software includes data analytics to help you track profit and trends.

Processing: All mathematical calculations and data visualizations (charts/graphs) are performed by the application on your hardware.

Privacy: No business-specific data points are uploaded to our servers during this analysis.

sections.title: 4. Security Measures
sections.content:
We protect the integrity of the software you download through:

Code Signing: Ensuring the app hasn't been tampered with since it left our "vault."

Checksum Verification: Providing SHA-256 hashes so you can verify your download is 100% malware-free.

sections.title: 5. Third-Party Services
sections.content: W2 Tech Solutions avoids third-party trackers. If an app requires an external service (like a cloud backup option you choose to enable), we will explicitly ask for your permission before any data leaves your device.

sections.title: 6. Your Rights
sections.content:
Under global privacy standards and the laws of Sri Lanka, you have the right to:

Access any personal information we hold (like your support emails).

Request the deletion of your contact information from our records.

Be informed of any changes to our data handling practices.
